author: .vbuterin
content: in theory, changeable code is what delegatecall forwarders are for

author: .vbuterin
content: that said, if we think delegatecall forwarders are too cumbersome, then it could make sense to enshrine a feature to replace them

author: .vbuterin
content: I actually think SETCODE is not the right idea, because delegatecall forwarders also server another function, which is to reduce per-contract deployment costs

author: .vbuterin
content: The right thing is probably to add a `CODE_ADDRESS` field to the account header

author: .vbuterin
content: so then "account code" becomes a store of immutable big blobs, and contracts point to which one they want to use
